Commands

Interface Command

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicCommand, BinaryCommand, Iteration, Sequence

    public interface Command
    An interface of commands, an ordered structure of instructions that can be executed by a robot.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Brecht Gosselé & William Mauclet 2BiR: wtk-cws (Gosselé) en cws-elt(Mauclet)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean containsNextStep(Robot robot, int lastStep)
      Returns whether this command contains a BasicCommand the given robot has not yet executed, and can execute.
      void execute(Robot robot)
      Executes this command.
      void executeStep(Robot robot, int stepNb)
      Executes the BasicCommand indicated by the parameter nextStep.
      int getNbBasicCommands()
      Counts and returns the number of basic commands in this command.
      int getStepNbOfNextStep(Robot robot, int lastStep)
      Returns the step number of the next basic command the robot can execute in this command.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this command.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        void execute(Robot robot)
        Executes this command.
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot that has to execute this command.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this command.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String representing this command.

      • getNbBasicCommands

        int getNbBasicCommands()
        Counts and returns the number of basic commands in this command.
        Returns:
        The number of basic commands in this command.

      • containsNextStep

        boolean containsNextStep(Robot robot,
                       int lastStep)
        Returns whether this command contains a BasicCommand the given robot has not yet executed, and can execute.
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot for which to check if it can execute a basic command in this command.
        lastStep - An integer defining unambiguously the last basic command the robot has executed of this command.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean true if this command contains a next BasicCommand the given robot can execute in view of the last step the robot has executed of this command and of the state of the robot itself. Returns a boolean false if this is not the case.

      • getStepNbOfNextStep

        int getStepNbOfNextStep(Robot robot,
                      int lastStep)
        Returns the step number of the next basic command the robot can execute in this command.
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot for which to look up the next basic command it can execute in this command.
        lastStep - An integer defining unambiguously the last basic command the robot has executed of this command.
        Returns:
        An integer indicating the stepNb of the next executable BasicCommand in this command for the given robot. This will depend on the last step the robot has executed of this command, and on the state of the robot itself.

      • executeStep

        void executeStep(Robot robot,
               int stepNb)
        Executes the BasicCommand indicated by the parameter nextStep.
        Parameters:
        robot - The robot that should execute a step of this command.
        nextStep - An integer defining unambiguously which basic command the robot has to execute of this command.
